comment: Very intuitive GUI. I love the ability to break down projects into tasks paired with context labels (think tags). I've tried many organization apps including Evernote, onenote, Jorte, Wunderlist etc., but this app is the first I have continually used and benefitted from. Those other apps are all fine, but this works best for me!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your kind feedback!

author: Abhishek Mendhekar
comment: I have been trying to find a GTD app that integrates across platforms as well as flexible in use. Chaos Control has the best mobile app for GTD and works well across platforms. MacOS app is good but I'd like more control over let's say the font size and themes to help me use it effectively. None the less this is a very good GTD app.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback and suggestions Abhishek! Enjoy

comment: I do not do reviews but phenomenal app. Great for work or personal stuff. Very easy to learn and use.  Showed it to the Senior project manager and asked him to try it. He has switched as well as the 4 others. Even the kids like it. Not a big app purchaser but will be getting the computer version.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much Brian! Glad that you like our app.

author: Joilene Rasmussen
comment: This app has simplified my life. I have Dissociative Identity Disorder, and this app helps my alters and I get or stay on a similar page. Everyone can see what is here, and add their own projects, in one central location, that cannot be misplaced or forgotten about, like a paper planner or random notes.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much Joilene! We're glad we could help

author: saobraonain Brennan
comment: Terrible app, I'd like a refund of my £6.49! Firstly you need a degree in computer programming to set customised reminders (i.e. Only on certain days of the month) then they either fail to go off or there is no snooze function. Extremely restrictive and fed up of being told to purchase the desktop version. Uninstalling now and will continue to use my phones default calendar and reminder app for free. Don't waste your time or money!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Hi. Let us address the issues you described:
1) You can set up to 16 different custom reminders for any given tasks. No "certain days" limitation
2) There is a snooze button on any reminder
3) You can check "don't show again" box at the Windows offer dialog

Clearly, some features could be easier to use. But you can always email us and we will help

author: STEVE SOL
comment: The home screen widget is too limited. Only 2 options, Chaos Box and Due Today. I'd really like to see my Contexts list as an optional default view in the widget. Using the GTD method, I like to see all tasks I can get done when a particular context is appropriate. Having a quick way right from my devices home screen to select a context from the list to see all related tasks, without having to open the app and select Contexts from the menu, that would be awesome.   Also, I try to launch the app on my Android Wear smartwatch and all I get is a spinning circle that vanishes quickly and I go right back to the watch home screen.  The app never opens on the watch.   Fix these 2 things and you will get 5 stars from me. But until then, 3 is all I can give.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Thanks for your feedback Steve.
P.S. We are not here for the stars though.

author: Hoshi Inoue
comment: (1) Came back after a few years and nothing has changed. (2) still can't attach multiple contexts. What do you do when you have a task for two or three different contexts? Just duplicate the task three times? (3) where do I see all over due-time tasks now at a glance apart from due today tasks?!?

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Hi Hoshi. We are adding multiple contexts later this year.

author: Anna Chudnovsky
comment: The app seemed good for everyday tasks, but when I tried to make my yoga tasks repeeting weekly, in different days of the week for each program, the app put all of the programs for every day  just for one week, then nothing. It seems like bugs: the function to repeat tasks doesn't work correctly for weekly repeating, put automatically due dates and time, change task settings and now, after many attempts to handle it, it rang all the time and after it lost the ring notifications to the weekly repeating tasks. What a drag! Please fix it

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Добрый день, Анна. В в переписке в почте мы вам помогли разобраться с повторяющимися задачами. Уточните, актуальна ли все еще проблема?

author: Devon Suns
comment: I was browsing the organizational apps and found the one that matches how I need things laid out. I love the folders for projects option, because I'm a student so I need separate classes but I'm also working on actual projects too. The only suggestions I'd make are maybe have one quick link to look at all overdue things and another for "no due date" things...and a dark mode option. Or I guess color options in general would be good because of color coding. But overall I'm immediately in love with this app.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback Devon! Have a productive week.

author: Mitchell Dusina
comment: Option to repeat based on due date AND an option to repeat based on when marked done. Both options are important. For some things, the next instance gets pushed off when you push off the current instance (dental cleaning for example). Other things shouldn't get pushed off (yearly tax preparation).

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Hi Mitchell, fair point.
We'll think about adding more repeating options in future updates.

author: Peter Edwards
comment: I use this on my PC, phone and tablet. Works well but could be a bit more intuitive and quicker to enter activity details; also, I would like a 'view all tasks' option where I could review and quick edit everything. Worth a good four stars as it is.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback Peter

author: Linda Sheffield
comment: Gtd apps can get tedious at times. This app is perfect; it syncs, there is no learning curve, and it works!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much Linda!

author: Jimmy Ledent
comment: Hi there, good app overall, it could be even better if you could add the Google calendar data to it, this way Chaos Control would be the only go-to app for schedule organising.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Hi Jimmy, thanks for the suggestion. You are right, we are adding full-featured calendar sync in upcoming releases.

author: James McShane
comment: The only thing I can really see missing is the ability to assign tasks to different users. I'd like to use this app in our business,  it makes so much sense. So my suggestion is to share other users in on a project and assign tasks to them. Their daily schedule would be a combination of their own tasks and assigned tasks.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion James. We are working on a business version of Chaos Control which will be available later this year and will support working in teams.

author: Cochina Ecaterina
comment: Trying to implement some GTD organising techniques and so far it is suitable to my needs. Not sure if the calendar has alerts incorporated or if it can be synced with phone calendar. Nice app in gen ;)

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your kind feedback!

author: Justin Zorig
comment: I think this app is very good however, it would be 5 stars if I could set up a weekly schedule where I can put in my classes instead of just recurring tasks

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion Justin. We are adding schedules in upcoming releases.

author: Pavlos Nik
comment: It's a great app combining a calendar with advanced to do list. The advantage over other calendars is that it enables "Categories"  (Projects) to organise your tasks/meetings, combining the best of calendars (scheduled to dos) and To Do Lists (unscheduled to dos). Also the yet-to-be categorised tasks (chaos box) is great. However, there is something totally missing from the picture. That is, contacts. I would love to be able to attach some names to some of my social tasks/activities, just like I do with places (contexts). I hope you consider it..

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Hi, thanks for the suggestion!
Definitely adding contacts in future updates.

author: Gergely Sallai
comment: This is one of the best GTD app out there that have all the crucial features. Another important point for me that this app is NOT subscription based, that is you only pay once. This is how others should do it! Keep up the good work!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much! Glad you like the app

author: Jonathon Richards
comment: The only thing I don't like so far is that the widget stops working periodically. Other than that, it is a great app for scheduling projects and tasks.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. We'll look into the widget issue.

author: Mahipal Suna
comment: This app is useful but not perfect then, if possible please add notes or thought option in this app.

author: Antoine Yacoub
comment: Have trailed many many apps over the years. Hands down the best. Moving forward, would love if you could 'cut and paste' projects and tasks, and have the option to create folders, projects and tasks any time at will rather than to have to follow the succession.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback Antoine.

author: Alex Pyzhianov
comment: Awesome app to manage any kind and number of activities in your life. So far the best I've seen

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much!

author: Christine Coates
comment: This app is WONDERFUL! So very helpful with organization skills building and goal-oriented too! I love this app, keep up the great work, very proud of this app & am recommending it to all my friends and family to help them too! Thank you for this app!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Wow, thank you so much Christine!

author: Mary Kamina
comment: This is by far the most useful app on my phone.    Apart from a few improvements here and there, very good job.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback Mary!

author: Nathan Rosson
comment: I think this app has its uses to help people like me get the many tasks they need to accomplish taken care of for the day so they do not forget.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Nathan!

author: Emil Zidane
comment: Very bad ... i lost my work twice 7 months ago and today after i reinstalled.  Fake backup i give up on this app.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Hi Emil, while we are sorry you have issues with the app it's pretty straightforward to setup cloud backup:
1) Purchase Premium
2) Create an account in the "Sync" settings of the app
3) All set. Your data is stored in the cloud and can be restored any time.

If you have difficulties with using the app please email us to cc@tarasov-mobile.com

author: Kelly Turnbow
comment: So far, so good. I was going to do something like this in a notebook, but I'm hoping the phone will be much more convenient.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Kelly!

author: Paul Grigorosita
comment: One issue I bought the premium but it will not let me download the premium app, which is a bit confusing since I paid for it. Other than that it's a great tool that helps me daily

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the purchase Paul. No need to worry about the separate paid app. As soon as you purchased Premium within this free app it upgraded itself to Premium.

author: Lori Sparks Hunter
comment: Reading the Getting Things Done book so not using the app fully yet

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content:
Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions:
cc@tarasov-mobile.com

author: LaVeda Hatchel Mason
comment: It works the way I think... and the developer is responsive. A five star app, with five star help... absolutely fantastic!

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks so much!

author: John Rivers
comment: I just started using the app. Its good so far. Not enough time using it to really know and get into it.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Hi John. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to email us: cc@tarasov-mobile.com

author: Valery Barabanov
comment: Работает эффективно и быстро,но хотелось бы увидеть больше функций:  Нет возможности делать подзадачи. Нет возможности конвертировать задачу в проект и наоборот. Нет множественных контекстов. Нет быстрых функций: приходится делать много манипуляций, чтобы сделать простые жесты, например, перенести на завтра. Очень редко обновляется.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Спасибо, Валерий, мы уже работаем над новыми функциями приложения

author: Angie Tucker
comment: Love this app. Easy to use and organize my projects.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Angie!

author: Vadim Ushakov
comment: Хороший органайзер, спасибо разработчикам. Но я столкнулся с глюком в приложении. Заходим в Проекты, жмём наверху иконку-карандаш, чтобы войти в режим редактирования. Теперь снова жмём наверху иконку, чтобы выйти из режима редактирования. И после этого плюсиком невозможно создать папку, создаётся только проект. Если в режим редактирования не заходить, то всё работает нормально: можно создавать и папки, и проекты. Большая просьба исправить баг.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Спасибо за сообщение о проблеме, Вадим, исправим

comment: Liked the context labels but immediately ran into the need for subtasks so I've moved on to Todoist.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion. Subtasks are coming in future updates.

author: José Renato Sprovieri
comment: It Attends the most necessities to organize tasks

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Jose

author: david nist
comment: Good app for the single-user. I've tried them all, this is the best so far.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks David!

author: Harry Alexis
comment: Good app but missing clickable URLs in Notes Field. Also no photo attachments...

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback Harry. We are adding attachments and links in the next big update.

author: Obbie Naughton
comment: Great app! I have a hobby farm and it keeps track of all my projects.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Obbie!

author: Charles Uibel
comment: Pretty simple in a good way. No share capability.

reply.author: Chaos Control
reply.content: Thanks Charles. We are adding sharing later this year.
